questions.text: There are several points in the course of a disease process : a. Disease onset b. Point of first possible detection c. Final critical point d. Usual time of diagnosis e. Final outcome For a screening programme to be effective it should be applied between :
The diagnostic power of a test to correctly exclude the disease is reflected by :
Lead time refers to the time between

options.label: A
options.text: Disease onset and first critical diagnosis

options.label: B
options.text: Disease onset and first possible point of detection

options.label: C
options.text: First possible point of detection and final critical point

options.label: D
options.text: First possible point to detection and usual time of diagnosis

questions.correct_answer: D. First possible point to detection and usual time of diagnosis

questions.text: Screening for condition recommended when :

options.label: D
options.text: Early diagnosis can change disease course because of effective treatment

questions.correct_answer: D. Early diagnosis can change disease course because of effective treatment

questions.text: Screening is done because of all except:

options.label: A
options.text: Testing for infection or disease in population in individuals who are not seeking health care

options.label: B
options.text: It is defined presumptive identification of unrecognized disease

options.label: C
options.text: Search for unrecognized disease or defect by means of rapidly applied test, examination or other procedures in apparently healthy individuals

options.label: D
options.text: Use of clinical or laboratory tests to detect disease in individual seeking health care for other reasons

questions.correct_answer: D. Use of clinical or laboratory tests to detect disease in individual seeking health care for other reasons

questions.text: Which of the following are the characteristics features of screening tests? a. Done on healthy people b. Done on unhealthy people c. More accurate d. Less accurate e. Less expensive f. Moe expensive g. Not a basis for treatment h. Used as base for treatment Select the correct answer using the code given below
Which of the following is an example of prospective screening :

options.label: A
options.text: Cervical pap smear in a 40 year old female

options.label: B
options.text: Neonatal screening in a newborn for hypothyroidism

options.label: C
options.text: Screening of immigrants in a country

options.label: D
options.text: Urine for sugar screening in a 40 year old male

questions.correct_answer: C. Screening of immigrants in a country

questions.text: In which of the following disease screening procedure increase the overall survival maximum :
Screening of cervical cancer at PHC level is done by :
Screening test has the following features except:

options.label: C
options.text: Test result are not arbitrary and preliminary

options.label: D
options.text: It can be used basis for treatment

questions.correct_answer: D. It can be used basis for treatment

questions.text: For the calculation of positive predictive value of a screening test the denominator is comprised of :
All comprise inherent properties of a screening test except :
The parameter of sensitivity and specificity are used for assessing :

A diagnostic test X has a sensitivity of 0.90 and a specificity of 0.50. The prevalence of disease Y in a certain population is 10%. What is the post-test probability (i.e., the probability that a person who tests positive actually has the disease)?
True about the following is :
questions.correct_answer: D. PPV is same as NPV

questions.text: Positive predictive value is most affected by :

A diagnostic test for a particular disease has a sensitivity of 0.90 and a specificity 0.90. A single test is applied to each subject in the population in which the disease population is 10% . What is the probability that a person positive to this test, has disease :

In a group of patient’s presenting to a hospital emergency with abdominal pain, 30% of patients have acute appendicitis. 70% of patient with appendicitis. Have a temperature greater than 37.5 degree Celsius and 40% of patient without appendicitis have a temperature greater than 37.5 degree Celsius. Considering these findings , which of the following statement is correct :

options.label: A
options.text: The sensitivity of temperature greater than 37.5 degree Celsius as a marker for appendicitis is 21/49

options.label: B
options.text: The specificity of temperature greater than 37.5 degree Celsius as a marker for appendicitis is 42/70

options.label: C
options.text: The positive predictive value of temperature greater than 37.5 degree Celsius as a marker for appendicitis is 21/30

options.label: D
options.text: The Specificity of the test will depend upon the prevalence of appendicitis in the population is which it is applied

questions.correct_answer: B. The specificity of temperature greater than 37.5 degree Celsius as a marker for appendicitis is 42/70

questions.text: Specificity of a screening test is the ability of a test to detect :

If the hemoccult test is negative for screening of colonic cancer, no further test is done. If the hemoccult test is positive the individual will have a second stool sample tested with the hemoccult II test. If this second for blood. the individual will be referred for more extensive evaluation. The effect of net sensitivity and net specificity of this method of screening is:

options.label: A
options.text: Net sensitivity and net specificity are both increased

options.label: B
options.text: Net sensitivity is decreased and and net specificity is increased

options.label: C
options.text: Net sensitivity is increased and net specificity is increased

options.label: D
options.text: Net sensitivity remain the same and net specificity is increased

questions.correct_answer: B. Net sensitivity is decreased and and net specificity is increased

questions.text: A screening test is used in same way in two similar population but the proportion of false positive result among population A is higher than those who test positive in population B. what is the likely explanation for this finding

options.label: A
options.text: The specificity of the test is lower in population A

options.label: B
options.text: The prevalence of disease is lower in population A

options.label: C
options.text: The prevalence of disease is higher in population A

options.label: D
options.text: The specificity of the test is higher in population A

questions.correct_answer: B. The prevalence of disease is lower in population A

questions.text: A test for hepatitis C is performed for 200 patient with biopsy proven disease and 200 patient known to be free of the disease . The test shows positive results on 180 of the patients with the disease , and negative result on 150 of the patient without the disease . Among those tested this test therefore:

options.label: A
options.text: Has a positive predictive value of 90%

questions.text: Due to an effective prevention program the prevalence of an infectious disease in a community has been reduced by 90%. Physician continues to use the same diagnostic test for the disease that she has always used how have the test’s characteristics changed :

options.label: B
options.text: Its positive predictive value has increased

options.label: C
options.text: Its negative predictive value has increased

options.label: D
options.text: The test characteristic have not changed

questions.correct_answer: C. Its negative predictive value has increased

questions.text: For the diagnosis of Deep vein thrombosis 2 tests are done together namely impedence plethysmography and leg scanning after injecting 125I fibrinogen. This process will lead to:
questions.correct_answer: B. Increasing the negative predictive value

questions.text: Which one of the following relationship shown between different parameter of a performance of a test is correct :

options.label: B
options.text: Positive predictive value = 1- negative predictive value

options.label: C
options.text: Sensitive is inversely proportional to specificity

questions.correct_answer: C. Sensitive is inversely proportional to specificity

questions.text: The usefulness of a screening test in a community depends on its
In a population of 10,000 people, the prevalence of a disease is 20%. The sensitivity of a screening test is 95% and specificity is 80%. The PPV of test will be
A test has high false positive rate in a community . True is :

A graph showing curves of Normal blood sugar level and Diabetic sugar level is shown below. Some area is found over lapping in the two curves. Diagnostic cut off point of 120 mg/ dL is also marked what does the shaded areas (D) represent in the graph :
You have clinically diagnosed a patient as having SLE at this point , you need to know :

options.label: A
options.text: Incidence of SLE and Predictive value of each test

options.label: C
options.text: Relative risk of SLE in this patient

options.label: D
options.text: Prior probability of each test sensitivity and specificity of each test

questions.correct_answer: D. Prior probability of each test sensitivity and specificity of each test

questions.text: Epidemiological survey of ‘at risk’ is called :
Which of the following is / are true about a screening test :
questions.correct_answer: C. Predictive value depends on prevalence

questions.text: A city has a population of 10000 with 500 diabetic patients. A new diagnostic test gives true positive result in 350 patients and false positive result in 1900 patient which of the following is false regarding the test
Most important factor for a test to be a good screening test is :
If prevalence is increased which of the following will be seen :

5000 persons underwent screening for a disease. Out of 500 diseased, 350 reported true positive and out of 4500 health 3000 reported true negative . Which of the following is correct about this screening test :

A diagnostic test for a particular disease has a sensitivity of 0.90 and a specificity of 0.80 . A single test is applied to each subject in the population in which the disease population is 30% what is the probability that a person . Negative to this test has no disease :
Denominator of negative predictive value :

options.label: A
options.text: Number of true negatives + number of false negatives

options.label: B
options.text: Number of true positive + number of true negative

options.label: C
options.text: Number of true positive + number of false positive

options.label: D
options.text: Number of true positive + number of false negative

questions.correct_answer: A. Number of true negatives + number of false negatives

questions.text: Calculate sensitivity and specificity based on following table
False negative means :

options.label: A
options.text: Person have disease but show negative test result

options.label: B
options.text: Person have no disease but shows negative test

options.label: C
options.text: Person have disease but show positive test result

options.label: D
options.text: Person have no disease but show positive test result

questions.correct_answer: A. Person have disease but show negative test result

Screening is not useful for

In a test of 150 people for HIV, Western blot found that 50 people are suffering from HIV & 100 were not suffering from HIV. Out of this 50, 30 had positive results with ICT kit & only 70 were found to be negative as per the kit from the 100 labelled as negative from the western blot. What is the sensitivity for this test?
Calculate the PPV:

A virulent bacterial infection has an 80% case fatality rate if it is not identified early in its course, however prompt administration of antibiotics decreased the mortality rate to <5%. The risks of the antibiotic therapy are minimal. Which of the following labelled points is most appropriate for use as the optimal diagnostic cut point for results of the test? Cut off at:

Doctor 1 diagnoses cervical cancer using PAP smear and mean age of diagnosis is 40 years, gives available treatment and patients die at 60 years. Doctor 2 diagnoses cervical cancer using a new screening test (Y) and mean age of diagnosis is 35 years, gives available treatment and patients die at 60 years. As compared to the doctor 1; doctor 2 has provided patient:
